intro: Palicourea eciliata, commonly known as the Brazilian moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are follicles that mature into slender, winged pods, aiding in seed dispersal. Palicourea eciliata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
